text: Elis Regina Carvalho Costa, known simply as Elis Regina (; Porto Alegre, March 17, 1945 – São Paulo, January 19, 1982) was a Brazilian singer. She is hailed as the best Brazilian singer of all times by many critics, musicians, and commentators.Goés, 2007, p.187Pugialli, 2006, p.170.Silva, 2002, p.193.Arashiro, 1995, p.39. ==Discography== *1961: Viva a Brotolândia *1962: Poema de Amor *1963: O Bem do Amor *1963: Ellis Regina *1965: Dois na Bossa *1965: O Fino do Fino – Elis & Zimbo Trio'' *1965: Samba, Eu Canto Assim! *1966: Dois na Bossa nº2 *1966: Elis *1967: Dois na Bossa nº3 *1968: Elis Especial *1969: Elis, Como & Porque *1969: Elis Regina in London *1969: Aquarela do Brasil – Elis Regina & Toots Thielemans *1970: Em Pleno Verão *1970: Elis no Teatro da Praia com Miele & Bôscoli *1971: Ela *1972: Elis *1973: Elis - no 2 *1973: Elis *1974: Elis *1974: Elis & Tom *1976: Falso Brilhante *1977: Elis *1978: Transversal do Tempo (live) *1979: Essa Mulher *1979: Elis Especial *1980: Saudades do Brasil *1980: Elis *1982: Montreux Jazz Festival *1982: Trem Azul *1983: Vento de Maio (compilation) *1984: Luz das Estrelas *1987: Personalidade *1994: Elis Regina no Fino da Bossa (live) *1994: Dose Dupla-Elis Regina *1995: Elis ao Vivo (live) *2001: Sucessos Inesquecíveis de Elis Regina (compilation) *2002: 20 Anos de Saudade (compilation) *2004: Little Pepper: The Definitive Collection (compilation) *2005: Elis Regina: MPB Especial 1973 *2006: Elis Regina Carvalho Costa *2006: Elis full color 3 DVD box set *2006: Por toda a minha vida *2006: Pérolas Raras *2012: Um Dia ==References== Category:1945 births Category:1982 deaths Category:Brazilian singers Category:People from Porto Alegre
